Posts.EditableText: me and thenobleone are making our own custom build, which will simply do what Quest does when connecting to the Qnet server. Edit: please visit http://www.squiggleuk.com/forums for more info and updates.
Posts.HTML:
me and thenobleone are making our own custom build, which will simply do what Quest does when connecting to the Qnet server.

Edit: please visit http://www.squiggleuk.com/forums for more info and updates.

Posts.EditableText: I think probably "alternative client" is better terminology than "custom build", since you're not using any of the original Quest code.
Posts.HTML: I think probably "alternative client" is better terminology than "custom build", since you're not using any of the original Quest code.

Posts.EditableText: Seems kind of cool. It'll be interesting to see.

Posts.EditableText:
I kinda remember a slayer from the last forums (still can't believe I began my life on that board with the question "so are these the new boards?".... *shivers*) but I don't remember anyone so hi (and thanks for the comment - w00t!).

Ste's gone through loads of names so maybe you remember him with one of his other names.... And Ste - that's gonna take a while to do. Wouldn't it just be easier to go through using Visual Basic rather then to try and fit in with Alex's ASL? And then if/when you get full ASL (what is it now - 350?) compliance, what are you going to do? You can't ADD syntax structures because ASL is Alex's code structure... The only way to get around it would be to code ASL-ALT (alternative anyone!?) where you use most of ASL's syntax but then your own too.... Kinda useless as you can use VB instead to create your game... The main reason I use Quest instead of code it in VB is because I find Quest to be easy to create games quickly - giving me the ability to create a "test" or "demo" version of the game easily and quickly.

Well the point of my project is to try and do it, i'm actually making a serious full on Text-Based RPG with this, it's just an idea i had about a project, and trying to get a cutom client to work with it.  i have seriously no idea whether or not it's going to work, but i will try either way.

plus, its alot quicker than trying to make a while new game with VB, we've already done it (Feudal Online), but got canceled coz we have hardly any time on our hands, and you know how that is.


And i dont think i could remember all of my names... but ill try...
